questions.text: is there a robot graveyard?
does an otter push an important button with its paw?
is a character compared to a hatchling breaking from a shell?
does a character tumble into a mudslide during a big storm?
does a character camouflage themself with dirt, sticks, twigs, ferns, leaves and flowers?
does someone learn the languages of many different kinds of animals by observing them while they are camouflaged?
does someone accidentally kill a family of geese?
does a beaver reprimand another beaver for being stubborn and rude?
does a character ask all of the animals to defecate (poop) in their garden?
does a goose become a flying fanatic?
does a bear give a character a ride home on her back?
does a character lose their foot and get a replacement wooden foot?
does a character welcome animals to join them during the winter to stay warm by
does a character notice that the wilder they acted, the more the animals liked the
does a character discover a factory where robots are built?
do a son and his adopted mother spend the winter apart?
do animals save their friend while others are attempting to capture the friend?
does a character devise a plan on an airship to get the repairs they need, escape, and find their way back home?
where does the story begin?
how many crates from the cargo ship survive the hurricane initially?
what kind of animals open the crate with the robot in it?
what is the robot’s full name and number?
what kind of an animal does Roz mimic to climb the cliffs?
what kind of animals does Roz awaken when she steps into a cave after the storm?
what is the hour each morning called when all the island animals are safe?
name two of the animals Roz meets during the Dawn Truce by name and type?
questions.answer: (Any two:) Swooper the owl, Dart the weasel, Digdown the groundhog, Fink the fox

questions.text: when Roz plummets off the side of the cliff, who does she land on?
what are two of the facts Roz retrieves about opossums?
questions.answer: (Any two:) They’re marsupials, they’re nocturnal, they mimic the appearance and/or smell of dead animals when threatened.

questions.text: what name is given to the surviving gosling after it hatches?
who builds a lodge for Roz and Brightbill?
what does Roz name her lodge?
what does Chitchat tell Brightbill that a squirrel nest is called?
why were the other goslings making fun of Brightbill?
questions.answer: His mother is a robot (or: His mother is a monster)

questions.text: why can’t Roz touch the button on her head?
questions.answer: Her hands automatically stop before they reach the button.

questions.text: what are the names of the bears that attack Roz?
who is the first animal to join Roz in the lodge by the fire during the winter?
what kind of animal does Roz save from the second lodge that catches on fire?
how many winters has Crag the turtle seen?
why is Rockmouth angry at the beavers?
questions.answer: He was trapped in the pond when the beavers built their dam.

questions.text: where do the geese stay when they are unexpectedly caught in a snowstorm on their flight south?
questions.answer: In a greenhouse on a farm.

questions.text: how does Roz commemorate the one-year anniversary of her arrival on the island?
what word is etched on the three robots on the airship that flies over the island?
according to the RECO robots, who does Roz belong to?
how is RECO 3 destroyed?
questions.answer: By the kicks of Broadfoot the bull moose

questions.text: how is RECO 2 finally destroyed after its battle with the bears?
how is RECO 1 destroyed?
questions.answer: He is shot by the geese

questions.text: after the battle with the RECOs, what body parts is Roz missing?
when Roz gathers the animals after the battle with the RECOs for the Dawn Truce, what does she tell them she has decided?
questions.answer: She will leave the island so she can protect her island friends from more danger

questions.text: who does the author think robots have some things in common with?
does a character have first lunch as part of their middle school schedule?
do certain lunch tables have nicknames like “Ribbon Ravine,” “Jock Mountain,” and “Valley of Burps & Smells?”
does a character eat lunch in the library alone at the beginning of sixth grade?
is there a class where students can earn a higher rank throughout the year?
does a character have an older half brother out of college who has their own apartment?
is a character offered extra credit for running for student council?
is a character’s favorite restaurant The Wonderful World of Waffles?
does a coin-flip determine which bedrooms two characters get to sleep in?
are there two teddy bears named Venus and Serena?
does a character think that sixth graders should be buddied up with older students at the beginning of middle school?
does a character tell someone else’s secret to someone in their gym class?
does a character join Color Guard?
what is the name of the twins’ new middle school?
which twin is the talker, and which twin is the thinker?
questions.answer: Francine is the talker, Maureen is the thinker

questions.text: name two of the three classes the twins have together.
which twin is ¼ inch shorter?
who is the twins’ advisory teacher?
what is the name and rank of Maureen’s Youth Cadet Corps instructor?
what is Francine’s favorite class after the first day of sixth grade?
Francine is how much older than Maureen?
according to Francine and Maureen’s dad, who is the “fifth gear” in their group of friends?
what student council position do Maureen and Francine both run for?
what is the name of the store where the salesperson is rude to Maureen and her friends?
how long do Francine and Maureen have to live in separate rooms?
questions.answer: Two weeks, or until the election is over

questions.text: what topic does Master Sergeant always put on the first exam?
what is the name of the seventh grade class president?
who tips off Maureen that her sister is being tutored after school?
which twin wins the student council election?
who is Maureen’s seventh grade buddy?
is a story told about King John of Portugal giving away a city as a dowry for his daughter’s marriage to King Charles II of England?
does one character dream of being a star chef with their own TV show?
is there a saying “If you invite trouble, it will come. It will stay for chai and for dinner.”
do a brother and sister use a notebook to share secrets at night?
are two friends sent to a farm in the country to get away from trouble?
does someone notice a flyer that says “Water is life. Stealing water is a crime.”
does a character get teased that okra is their favorite vegetable?
does a character conquer their fear by climbing a rickety ladder to the roof?
does a character learn from a security guard that their mother thinks they are as smart as her mother’s sister?
does a character celebrate not getting fired from their first day on the job?
does a character learn the day before about an important practice exam?
do two characters share a bowl of noodles while they study for the same exam?
do two characters hope that a stolen photograph will alert the police to the leader of a crime ring?
a character chooses what color to paint the family house?
a mango is given as a thank you gift. What for?
we learn that Bombay was made up of how many disconnected islands?
the room a brother and sister share is filled with photographs from magazines. What are the photographs of?
a character’s mother teaches them how to make what?
a character is told not to go into a certain room because of who lives there. Who is it?
two characters get into trouble for playing a card game together. What is the name of the card game?
a character wins a scholarship for a special kind of class. What is the class and when does it meet?
questions.answer: Computer class and it meets on Sundays

questions.text: a character recognizes something about someone’s father, and drops what they are holding. What did they recognize and what did they drop?
questions.answer: The man’s voice, a bowl of pudding

questions.text: a character is often late for school and gets in trouble. Their teacher makes a suggestion that might help, what is it?
questions.answer: To boil their water at night

questions.text: a character suggests adding something to the rotis to make them softer. What is it?
a character’s mother is diagnosed with a disease that she got from drinking water that was not boiled. What is the disease?
a character loses their job and starts their own business. What is the business selling and what is its name?
did the main character’s mother disappear right before their thirteenth birthday?
is the “Many Worlds” principle described as other universes pushed up right next to us, almost identical to ours but with small changes?
does a doctor lie about calling the library to try to locate the main character’s father?
are two friends described as “remainders;” both living an extra careful life so their parents won’t relive the pain of losing a child?
do friends prepare an email for delayed delivery which would explain they were on a mountain search?
do Initials and their time traveling selves appear to stutter or shimmer if they are in close proximity to each other?
is there a secret society to protect the timeline?
does a character keep a note in his pocket from his grandmother that reads “I was wrong. Don’t trust anyone?”
does ISTA, The International Society for Temporal Adherence, become a problem?
does an unknown character occasionally speak directly to the reader between chapters?
are “nodes’ like knots on a thread where you can grab hold and then jump off; they’re markers and landing points?
are “imprints” alternative timelines from the “prime imprint” of the original timeline?
does the story include multiple universes, each with multiple timelines?
why was Finn reluctant to go swimming with his good friend Gabi at the quarry?
questions.answer: It was where his twin sister had drowned.

questions.text: Gabi and Finn became friends when she dreamt that he was in trouble and couldn’t get back home. What did she send him?
who are the two tiny figures in the quarry photo that Finn studies in his father's office?
what gender have the family’s time travelers been?
questions.answer: Female; they have all been women

questions.text: Finn’s mother built a portal, a way to reach her in an emergency. What is the portal made from?
Finn and Gabi come upon a cabin in the woods. What is nailed above the door?
who is trying to make decisions about what should be changed in history?
questions.answer: Doc and/or his faction of ISTA

questions.text: Finn is told of the most powerful time traveler in their family. Who is it?
Finn finally finds his mother who then shares her plan with him. Why does resentment explode inside Finn after his mother asks for his help?
questions.answer: His mother never intends to return home with him; she will stay behind to try to raise and teach his sister with love.

questions.text: before time traveling to find his sister, Faith, Finn feels in his pocket for his meager arsenal of three objects. What are any two of the three objects?
questions.answer: Gran’s note, the grounding stone, and/or the skeleton key ring

questions.text: Gran tells Finn that time is stubborn, and changing the outcome of time is not about the beat of a wing or catching a later bus. What does Gran say is the key to changing timeline outcomes?
questions.answer: If you want to change time, you must change hearts. It’s about people’s choices to be kind.

questions.text: Gabi finally teases Finn that he should fear and respect her because she is now part machine. Why is she now “part machine?”
questions.answer: Gabi’s serious injuries left her with metal pins inserted into her arm.

questions.text: the book closes with Finn mentally connecting with an old woman who is standing in front of a bank. Who is she?
do they visit Village Ice Cream?
did someone break their arm skateboarding?
does someone have a bike named Magic Broom?
do they listen to the Beastie Boys after the first day of school?
do they have pizza night with extra cheese, extra sausage and lots of olives?
did someone’s grandma lose a leg because of diabetes?
does the character live 8 blocks away from school?
are they doing a puzzle with a Yeti on top of a mountain?
do they eat breakfast for dinner, pancakes and bacon and scrambled eggs?
did someone receive a guitar on their seventh birthday?
does someone have a pillow that smells like lavender oil?
is the phrase “I need the trail” used as a code?
do they reference the song “I Wanna Dance With Somebody” by Whitney Houston?
in what year does the book begin?
what is their dad’s nickname?
how many “pounds of pain” is his father?
which friend can divide fractions in their head?
what does the note say that was pinned to Ollie when he was abandoned at the church?
questions.answer: Please take care of this baby. And love him like crazy too.

questions.text: what is the name of the town they live in?
what genre of book does ZJ like to read?
what is the name of Ollie’s mother?
what color rain boots does Daniel have?
what did they name the birch tree?
what position does Sightman play?
which birthday are they celebrating for Daniel, when they meet at the skate park?
what does ZJ call his dad’s older sister?
is a character forbidden to cross the creek?
does a character’s grandmother make medicines and potions from plants and herbs? herbs?
does a cat use a green sock as a comfort item?
is a village known for making beautiful rag dolls?
can a character predict things that will happen in the near future?
does a king seek to make an alliance with eleven other rulers?
is a large event to celebrate a character’s fifteenth birthday approaching?
is it said that the river is so dangerous that only flotsam survives?
is there a secret passageway hidden behind a bookshelf?
is it said that hot chocolate calms the soul?
does a character drink hot chocolate sprinkled with cayenne pepper?
does a type of magic only work in the sunshine?
is a character delivered a secret note that says, Don’t eat the pastries?
is a character meant to change their shoes as part of a birthday ceremony?
is a character excited to find that their dress was made with pockets?
does a character wear a flotation vest filled with the fluffy fibers from the seed pods of kapok trees?
does a character call themselves a “flume-ologist?”
does a character make a pair of shoes out of leather and cotton?
does a character name a raft after their mother?
what type of bird is Lázaro?
the ancestors of what creature inhabit the oyamel forest?
what is Solimar’s Abuela’s full name?
what are the first names of Solimar’s parents?
what is Solimar’s brother’s given first name, and what is the nickname everyone has called him since he was a toddler?
what is the name of the massive fair in Puerto Rivera?
which herb does Abuela need for a medicinal tea that treats headaches and stomach ailments?
María’s mother was planning on making a pineapple cake for dessert, but changed her mind. What does she decide to make instead?
what is Solimar’s nickname for Señor Verde?
what is the name of the ship on which Campeón plans to secretly work as a deckhand?
what is the full name of the magical folk healer who lives on the shadowy side of the mountain, and what is she more familiarly known as?
what strong scent does Abuela say helps with remembering?
what drains the strength of the butterflies protected within Solimar’s rebozo?
what is Lázaro’s original country of origin?
what will Solimar’s full title be once she is crowned Princess?
questions.answer: Princess Solimar Socorro Reyes Guadalupe of San Gregorio

questions.text: what is the name of the extremely dangerous second waterfall that Solimar must avoid on the river?
questions.answer: El Salto de los Ángeles (or Leap of Angels)

questions.text: what is the name of the net Berto has engineered over a waterfall?
how long ago did Berto’s father die?
the final cavern of the labyrinth cave is filled with what animal?
who switches places with King Sebastián to pose as king for their escape?
does someone use a white-noise machine?
are siblings compared to Russian dolls, based on their similar appearances?
is there a neighbor named Ms. Patel?
are there siblings of Syrian descent?
do they visit the neighborhood called Forked River?
does someone declare that they are going to go to culinary school, business school, and play baseball?
is it stated that it’s a scientific fact that once a kid turns fourteen, they start turning into a grump?
is there a diner that has been missing the L in their sign that says Daily?
is there a coupon for Perry’s Golf Course?
is someone pee-shy?
is there a dog that likes cucumbers?
do they make Chicken Cutlets?
do they make cupcakes that look like bald eagles?
does someone add goat cheese to the omelet?
how long was the Chaparral boat that their Mom was working on?
what did the arrival of the Badger Boys mean?
how many feet wide was the lagoon from the end of their dock to the beginning of the Badgers’ dock?
the marshes are a national wildlife refuge and what are two types of birds that call it home?
what is the name of the thirteen foot Boston Whaler?
what is Pork’s real name?
how long has Sam been a member of the AliO’Connor family?
what is the name of Mr. Martin’s boat?
what is the name of the most lively restaurant on the river?
what type of animal eats the fiddler crabs?
how much does an ad cost for the biggest square on the mat at the diner?
questions.answer: Seven hundred forty-nine dollars and ninety-five cents

questions.text: where does everyone take their boats on the 4th of July?
what is the name of the Perezs’ boat?
what is Sam’s grandmother’s room number?
Sam’s grandma recites a poem by which poet to Harbor?
how many flukes were Mr. Martin and Mr. Harris each able to keep?
is Chapter One made up of nothing but repetitions of the letter X periodically separated by spaces and punctuation?
does an ornate wooden box have inside a small brass plaque with the words: The Symphony of Smells?
does a character cut every hair on their head the exact same length because they didn’t like to favor one hair over another?
are the parents of a newborn so bitter and angry in their disagreement over choosing their baby’s name that they got a divorce as soon as they left the hospital with the baby?
does a character practice lying by telling their mother that “they don’t have plates in Thailand?”
do divorced parents believe that every child should be raised with two parents in the house, so they live in separate halves of a house that has been split down the middle?
do we read most of the story of “La Storia della Mia Vida” about two fraternal twins who were born in Italy and then sent to America together to escape Benito Mussolini?
is synesthesia, the condition of sounds and colors and sounds all mixed up in one’s head, an important element?
does a circus Ringmaster try to sell a pair of ten-year-old twins to a stranger for a few dollars?
does a character send the school principal information about a missing student using a ransom note instead of a standard tip-off note from a concerned citizen?
does the author assert that school subjects like math, English, and history are unnecessary in life, but Egyptology comes in handy time after time?
is a character told by a doctor to practice having feelings? To name and then sit with his feelings for a while?
were evil alchemists searching for the secret of everlasting life?
the author wants the real location of the story to remain a mystery, so where does he ask the reader to imagine the story takes place?
questions.answer: “Your Hometown,” or the place that you live in.

questions.text: Cass has a distinguishing physical feature. What is it?
questions.answer: She has rather large, pointy ears.

questions.text: while Cass is being introduced we learn her two word motto. What is it?
Max-Ernest repeatedly poses this riddle: What is not enough for one, just right for two, and too much for three? What is the answer?
what is the secret word necessary to use the elevator in the magician’s house?
Max-Ernest defines an anagram for Cassie. What is an anagram?
questions.answer: “It’s when two words have all the same letters but in a different order.”

questions.text: whose private office created the illusion of infinitely expanding space with many reflecting panels of mirrors on the walls and ceiling?
Ms. Mauvais suggests that Cass get cosmetic surgery to change her appearance. What body part does Ms. Mauvais reference?
Max-Ernest tells Cass that Dr. L will cure his condition with a lobotomy using a straw entering through what body part to reach his brain?
Ms. Mauvais rips off her long white glove after Cass spills the contents of a wine glass upon it. What is everyone shocked to see?
questions.answer: The ungloved hand of a very old woman [thin and frail fingers, nails yellow and cracked, and skin so translucent you could see bones, ligaments and veins].

questions.text: what did all the many guests waiting for admittance to the pyramid have in common?
Max-Ernest could not swim and was afraid to cross the moat to the pyramid. Why didn’t he drown?
questions.answer: The water was only waist deep and they could wade across.

questions.text: the book ends with a coded letter inviting Cass and Max-Ernest to become members of the Terces Society. The letter is signed “with the greatest admiration and respect, P.B.” Who is P.B.?
questions.answer: The missing magician, and twin brother to Dr.L, Pietro Bergamo

questions.text: does a character’s mother die when they are only four years old?
does a newspaper headline read Tokyo Philharmonic Staves Off Deadly Typhoon?
does a character find out their mother did not die in a car crash, as they had always been told?
is a character given a piece of grape chewing gum in case of motion sickness?
is there a magical cat named Wynk?
does a character get mistaken for another student with the exact same name?
is a wooden whistle with three holes actually a key?
does a character find a book in the library that their mother checked out seven times?
is the school’s main auditorium called “The Shell?”
is there a lake called Orpheus Lake?
does a character steal someone’s cat as a trade?
do characters get trapped by magical trees?
does a character have an important test on Halloween?
is there a tornado made up entirely of ghosts?
is a character brought back from the dead?
does a character’s grandmother forget her email password?
what is the first rule of Musicraft?
questions.answer: A spell can charm or do great harm. Before you play, clear the way.

questions.text: what is Amelia’s Mystwick School audition number?
what song is the simple drying spell Amelia tries to use to clean up the grape juice she spilled before her audition?
which two instruments does Jai’s dad believe are not serious enough?
what kind of vehicle picks Amelia up for her first day of school?
how many people in the world are licensed to teleport anything bigger than a refrigerator?
name two of the four teacher Maestros of Mystwick School of Musicraft.
questions.answer: (Any two) Miss Noorani, Mr. Walters, Miss Becker, Mr. Pinwhistle

questions.text: what is the full name of the Headmaestro of Mystwick?
what song does Amelia play at the edge of the Echo Wood on her first day at Mystwick?
what are the only two ways to leave Mystwick for good?
questions.answer: Either by graduating or being expelled

questions.text: what is Darby’s actual first name?
what is the name for all the students who play woodwind instruments?
what four colors represent different kinds of spells?
who is the school nurse, the librarian, and the dean of students?
what is the name for the metal staples clamped onto the ears of musicians who use magic for evil purposes?
what is the name of the school rock club?
what is Amelia’s dad’s full name?
what is the name of Amelia’s favorite opera?
what is Amelia’s actual middle name?
does the story begin during monsoon rains and thunderstorms?
does the team captain stand in for her basketball coach when he has to leave early?
does someone use a scooter to give assistance to someone with an injured leg?
does someone change out of their tennis shoes into flip flops when they get home from work?
are the students studying the Pacific Rim of Fire?
does a student fall asleep in class because they stayed up late playing Star Wars: Battlefront?
does an elephant join a basketball team?
does the main character admire a Golden State Warrior basketball player?
does a character dig a pool in the middle of the night?
does a main character rediscover swimming as an enjoyable activity?
does someone overhear a conversation about herself while she’s in the girls’ restroom?
does the basketball team travel to another team’s game?
does someone love pineapple Cold Whip with extra coconut topping?
Jordan has two favorite basketball players. Who are they?
Hans brings smoothies for his sister and friend. What kind are they?
Jordan hears something whimpering in the playground on the way home from school. What is it?
Jordan prays to an elephant god to watch over her elephant friend. What is the name of the god?
what is the first name that Jordan suggests for her elephant?
who is Jordan named for?
Jordan’s dad pretends to be shopping for Nanek’s sewing club. What are two of the things he buys?
Jordan’s basketball coach recommends that she try out for what other school athletic team?
why does Jordan miss the basketball team’s first game?
questions.answer: She has to stay late at water polo practice

questions.text: Kemala is afraid she will lose her scholarship. Why does she need it so badly?
questions.answer: Their farm isn’t doing well because of the drought

questions.text: in the last 10 seconds of the water polo game who scores?
it turns out that the elephant is not an elephant. What is it?
does the character say “I’m a Girl Scout, and I’m here to save you”?
do they have curtains that are tan colored?
is there a turtle night-light?
was there a packet of coupons for jumbo shrimp and other “sea delights”?
do they plan to blame the shredding of the letters on the birds?
do they have Coco Pops, Froot Loops and Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal?
do they own a backpack shaped like a turtle’s shell?
are they warned to not try the clam flavored ice cream?
is there a stuffed animal horse named Mr. Stickhorse?
do they have a box of crayons with ninety-six colors?
did they want to rename golf carts “Danger Mobiles”?
did they go see The Wizard of Oz?
did they order a chocolate-cherry ice cream cone?
is someone’s scent identified as cinnamon toast and raspberry shampoo?
did someone become mildly obsessed with Hungry Hungry Hippos?
did they get a wild-cherry slurpee?
did they attend a Science Explorers camp?
does their mom make pancakes on Christmas morning, sometimes with strawberries in them?
what flavor are the crunchies first fed to Leonard?
according to Leonard’s joke, how many park rangers does it take to change a light bulb?
how tall is Earth’s largest flower?
what is the name for a group of cats?
how long can alpine swifts fly without stopping?
what are the mountains made of on Leonard’s home planet?
which friend of Olive’s owns a family farm?
how many stingrays are at the aquarium?
what are the two sharks named at the aquarium?
how many days does the average human live for?
what percentage of Antarctic ice is made from penguin urine?
what is the first message that Leonard types to Olive?
questions.answer: hello olive, it is me leonard i am an alien do not be scared.

questions.text: how old is Olive?
what is the date of Norma’s Save the Sea Turtles event?
what color is Olive’s beach towel?
what year was Q’s Winnebago?
according to Norma, what's the name of the cafe that makes biscuits that are an educational experience?
how far away from Old Faithful were they when the Winnebago broke down?
is the design and writing meant to be friendly to readers with dyslexia?
does a street dead-end at the St. Luke’s Epicopal Church Cemetery?
is a sister mad about a drawing of her napping when she was supposed to be watching her siblings?
does someone get teased for having a “nickname” and no middle name?
does someone find relief from a busy household by drawing on the wall beside their bed?
does someone rely on reading their friends lips as they read out loud from Western movie posters?
do the kids build a clubhouse using old fence slats, bricks for the floor and a car window?
does a mother keep her kid’s dinner warm by covering it with an upside down plate and setting it on top of a pot of water on a low flame?
does someone get in trouble for wanting to see the Steel Pier High-Diving Horses?
does someone accidentally kill a small bird with their bow and arrow?
does someone consider their work helping to paint hex signs as great training?
does someone drop out of college and get a job at a florist’s shop delivering flowers?
does a museum purchase an original oil painting to hang in its collection, and give a shout out to the artist on their 81st birthday?
Jerry’s favorite place to draw in his crowded home is where?
Jerry finds a stash of what kind of magazines in a wardrobe full of bed linens? What was the main topic of those magazines?
Jerry’s mother gives him something to calm his stomach before going to school. What is it?
a teacher asks Jerry to help with a school wide unit about safety by doing what?
questions.answer: Drawing a fire engine on the chalkboard

questions.text: the boys ride their bikes to the Ben Franklin Bridge which crosses which river?
what color are the police cars in Philadelphia?
the family goes to the Jersey Shore for vacation. What is the name of the Black section of beach?
Jerry and his friends would offer shoe-shines outside of Woolworth five-and-dime. How much did they charge?
Jerry finds the perfect still life in a shop window. What is in the shop window?
Jerry meets a real artist while selling newspapers. What is the artist’s name and what does he draw to make a living?
questions.answer: John Liney. A comic strip named HENRY.

questions.text: what is the subject of Jerry’s first oil painting?
Jerry goes to Murrell Dobbins Vocational High School to study what?
the Philadelphia Museum of Art mounts a solo exhibition of Jerry’s work. What is the name of the exhibit?
questions.answer: Witness: The Art of Jerry Pinkney

questions.text: does a character quit their job at the hospital because they hate that everybody isn’t treated the same?
did a character have the nickname “Cheetah” as a kid?
does a character live with their brother, sister, mom, and two grandparents in a house built in the 1930s?
is a character a third grader at Douglass Elementary?
does a girl character anchor the boys’ 4x100 relay track team?
is a character told to take off their hat on the first day of school?
does a character want to look like football star Patrick Mahomes?
does a character put a relaxer in their hair to straighten it?
can a character afford to buy thirty pieces of ten-cent candy from the candy store?
does a character get a visit from the County Health Inspector?
does a character invite the whole town to a special competition?
does a character teach ceramics classes?
does a character rent a chair in a shop on weekends?
how old are the Jones kids when they usually get their first haircut?
name two of the three kids’ haircuts offered at Hart and Son Barbershop.
what was the name of the college where J.D.’s parents met as track stars?
name the town and state where J.D. lives.
what business did J.D.’s grandfather go into after retiring from running the local JCPenney?
what is the first and last name of the only girl on J.D.’s peewee football team?
what does it mean for Jordan’s family to be “Creasters?”
questions.answer: They only go to church on Christmas and Easter

questions.text: who is on the cover of the Madden NFL 20 video game?
how much does a kids’ haircut cost at Hart and Son Barbershop?
what type of cream does J.D.’s mom use monthly to straighten her hair?
how old is Justin when J.D. cuts his hair for the first time?
when J.D. cuts Jordan’s hair for the first time, what two images does he shave into the haircut?
how much does J.D. charge his friends for haircuts when he first starts his business?
what is the name of the County Health Inspector?
what does J.D. buy with his earnings?
what is the first of three hairstyles the contestants have to cut in the Great Barber Battle?
is a Sunday trip to the hair salon a weekly family tradition?
do two girls end up crying together in a closet because they don’t compare well to Diana?
does the main character say they don’t want to see family sometimes because they are worried they will make fun of them?
does the main character wonder if they could make their hair be “what it was supposed to be,” then people would let them be themself?
is someone teased by being told they look like they got electrocuted, and they look like Chewbacca?
does a mother say that straightened hair makes it easier to fit in and looks more professional?
do we learn that the main character’s mother was bullied about her own appearance in her youth?
does a character and their aunt share “wash day 101” together?
does a mother sit down on the kitchen floor with her daughter to have a serious talk about feelings?
do friends watch video tutorials for styling advice?
does a chicken named Cantinflas warm up to the main character?
does someone distract herself at the salon by pretending she is like Dulce Maria from the Super Amigas?
does a best friend say, “You know I love your curls! But it doesn’t make a difference what you look like to me. I just want you to be happy.”?
the book opens with an extra visit to the hair salon to prepare for a special occasion. What is the occasion?
before “picture time” at the quince, Mami scolds Marlene and asks her “What happened to your hair?” How does Marlene respond?
what is Marlene’s favorite class at school?
what do kids in her class stick in Marlene’s hair?
while visiting Marlene’s home, cousin Diana says “I am so glad I have…you know…” What is she glad to have?
how does Marlene describe her ears after her mom braids her hair?
where is Tia Ruby’s garden?
when Marlene asks “Why don’t we like our own hair?”, how does Tia Ruby respond?
questions.answer: She says “Because of something called anti-Blackness”

questions.text: what do Marlene and Ruby eat while waiting for Marlene’s hair to dry?
after Marlene lets her hair go more natural, who is the next person who stops straightening their naturally curly hair?
Marlene says her house is like every house, except their furniture is really big, and they have a lot of pictures of someone. Who do they have a lot of pictures of?
during wash day 101, what comes after the product part, and before the waiting for hair to dry? You flip your hair over and do what?
the “reveal station” is also known as what?
is there a teacher named Ms. Hayley?
does the character have a mom named Nina?
does the character have the nickname Cupcake?
does their mom sing “Good Night Sweetheart” before bed?
is there a teacher named Mr. Olsen?
is there a place called Millington Sables?
did they throw a milk carton into the ceiling fan and sprayed the whole school?
does the character eat 11 carrot sticks while waiting?
is their principal named Principal Dickens?
do they bury their happy meal toys in the snow?
is there a map on yellow paper drawn with a pink marker?
do they receive a purple party invitation with sparkly gold ink?
do they play ultimate Uno?
do they hate mashed potatoes?
do they play ballet HORSE?
what is the name of the farm where the horse Summer camp is going to be?
what color does Gwendolyn associate with the feeling of anger?
what does Gwendolyn say that fish oil smells like?
what color is Tyler’s backpack?
what is the name of Gwendolyn’s school?
what topic do Thais and Gwendolyn chose to study for their project?
during her 3rd grade assessment what does the color green signify?
what color is Tyler’s laptop?
what is the name of Hettie’s brother?
what is Gwendolyn’s higher power?
what is Thais’ last name?
what is the grand prize that Gwendolyn wins in Mr. Olsen’s class?
what is Hettie’s response to Gwendolyn’s text “U WERE RITE! I’ll be at camp!”?
what color glasses does Marty’s mom have?
what does the flag say hanging in Marty’s room?
what is Hettie’s last name?
what is the first item on the Awesome Things About Ryler Rogers list?
does Big Jean, The World’s Most Intelligent Elephant, solve math problems on a chalkboard?
is Victoria also known as The Amazing Amazonian Bird Woman?
did children chew jelly cubes that lit up whenever they bit down on them, and the candy glowed right through the skin of their cheeks?
is the music of pipes and drums heard before a magic circus appears?
do friends create a school project using knots like an Incan quipu?
does a character offer someone a miracle “as long as it is within my power.”?
is a character called both “Lightbender” and the Man Who Bends Light?
does a character twist or yank her braids when she is nervous?
is there a menagerie where all of the animals were magical in some way, free from their cages, and very friendly?
does a breeze blowing through the classroom retie knots to form the message: “Midnight. Follow the wind”?
does one character try to convince their friend that grandpa’s stories about magic are not real?
is a family bootlace important to the story?
does Gertie jump off a roof believing that Victoria would catch her?
what did Ephraim use as an entrance ticket for his first visit to the circus?
Ephraim performs the only trick he knows for the Lightbender. What is it?
questions.answer: Ephraim uses his bootlace to tie a knot of great complexity.

questions.text: who is the manager of the circus?
two of the main characters are a grandfather and grandson. What are their first names?
what did Jenny need to do to first see the magic circus?
questions.answer: Just pretend for a second. (and/or) Just say, “It’s a magic circus.”

questions.text: what are the two circus tents that are most intriguing to Ephraim?
questions.answer: The tents of The Bird Woman and The Man Who Bends Light

questions.text: who came all the way from Arizona to make sure things were “done correctly” while Grandpa Ephraim was sick?
what type of animal is Chintzy the messenger?
how did Victoria Starling's parents die?
who visited Jenny and Micah in the treehouse, smelling of sewage?
Micah teaches Jean something no other elephant knows. What is it?
Grandpa Ephraim saved his miracle for his grandson. What was Grandpa Ephraim’s last wish?
questions.answer: For the Lightbender to take Micah to Circus Mirandus
